title: Ulberg dominates Reyes with first-round KO at UFC Fight Night in Perth
summary: Carlos Ulberg dropped Dominick Reyes in the opening round for his ninth straight win at UFC Fight Night in Australia.

title: Crowd crush at political rally in southern India kills 39 people
summary: Crush at actor-politician Vijay’s rally in Tamil Nadu kills 39 people, including eight children; 40 others injured.

title: Russian FM vows ‘decisive response’ if attacked by the West
summary: Russia's FM warned NATO at the UNGA that any aggression against Russia would be met with a 'decisive response'.

summary: Saudi Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud, speaking at the UN General Assembly, condemned Israel’s war on

title: Hundreds of thousands evacuate as Vietnam braces for Typhoon Bualoi
summary: Three fishermen are reported missing after their vessels sank off the coast of Quang Tri province.

title: Marc Marquez wins 2025 MotoGP world championship at Japanese Grand Prix
summary: The 32-year-old wins his first MotoGP riders' title since 2019 after finishing second to Francesco Bagnaia at Motegi.

title: Moldova holds parliamentary elections hit by claims of Russian interference
summary: Most polls project the governing pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity in the lead.

title: At least 4 killed in major Russian drone, missile attack on Ukraine’s Kyiv
summary: Media reports and independent monitor describe the latest strikes on Ukraine as 'one of the heaviest' since war began.

title: LIVE: Israel kills 29 people in Gaza since dawn, child dies of malnutrition
summary: An infant has died of malnutrition and lack of treatment in southern Gaza's Khan Younis, according to Nasser Hospital.

title: Poland briefly closes airspace as NATO increases presence in the Baltic Sea
summary: Denmark reports new drone incursions, while neighbouring Norway says it is investigating two drone sightings.

title: Israeli team out of top Italian cycling race over Gaza war protest concerns
summary: Italian race organiser says there is high possibility of race disruption due to participation of Israeli team.

title: Thousands protest livestreamed murder of 2 women, young girl in Argentina
summary: Drug gang suspected in torture and murder of two young women, and a 15-year-old girl, in crime that shocks Argentina.

title: Un an après, des milliers de partisans du Hezbollah commémorent la mort de Nasrallah
summary: Des milliers de partisans du Hezbollah affluaient, samedi, au mausolée de leur ancien chef Hassan Nasrallah, assassiné par Israël il y a un an jour pour jour. Malgré son affaiblissement, le mouvement chiite réaffirme son refus du désarmement exigé par le pouvoir libanais.

title: Flotille pour Gaza : les appels à une protection diplomatique de la France se multiplient
summary: Un collectif de plus de 130 artistes et personnalités a réclamé, samedi, aux gouvernements français et belge une "protection diplomatique" de la flottille internationale en route avec de l’aide humanitaire vers Gaza. Les militants pro-palestiniens à bord ont fait état de plusieurs attaques de drones contre leurs embarcations.

title: Liban : "Le Hezbollah est dans une phase de transition" selon Bachir El Khoury
summary: Bachir El Khoury, chef du service Moyen-Orient à Courrier International, est notre invité.

title: Gaza : Israël dit avoir frappé "plus de 140 cibles" en 24 heures
summary: La Défense civile de la bande de Gaza a fait état d'au moins cinquante morts dans des frappes israéliennes vendredi à travers le territoire palestinien dévasté par près de deux ans de guerre.

title: Commémorations au Liban un an après la mort de Hassan Nasrallah
summary: Le Hezbollah commémore samedi l'assassinat par Israël il y a un an de son chef de l'époque Hassan Nasrallah, début d'une guerre qui a fortement affaibli le mouvement armé chiite soutenu par l'Iran et a détruit une grande partie du Liban.

title: Cisjordanie: des firmes liées au développement des colonies épinglées par l'ONU
summary: Le vendredi 26 septembre, l'ONU a mis à jour la liste des firmes liées dans le développement des colonies israéliennes, jugées illégales au regard du droit international. Cette nouvelle version recense 158 sociétés, majoritairement israéliennes.

title: Nucléaire iranien : l'échec de négociations entre les Européens et Téhéran
summary: Les sanctions onusiennes contre la République islamique seront formellement rétablies samedi soir, sauf coup de théâtre, après l'échec de négociations entre les Européens et Téhéran. L'Iran a de son côté rappelé samedi "pour consultations" ses ambassadeurs en France, en Allemagne et au Royaume-Uni, a rapporté la télévision d'État.

title: Nucléaire iranien : le rétablissement imminent des sanctions
summary: Siavosh Ghazi, notre correspondant à Téhéran, décrypte la situation.

title: "Finir le travail" à Gaza : le discours offensif de Netanyahu à l'ONU
summary: La création d'un État palestinien constituerait un "suicide national" pour Israël, a déclaré vendredi à la tribune de l'ONU le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, promettant de "finir le travail" contre le Hamas à Gaza.

title: Reconnaissance de la Palestine : confusion et erreurs autour des consulats britannique et français
summary: Après leur reconnaissance d’un État palestinien, la France et le Royaume-Uni sont accusés d'avoir indiqué que leurs consulats généraux à Jérusalem étaient désormais situés en "Palestine". Mais le consulat britannique est bien situé à Jérusalem-Est, considéré comme territoire palestinien occupé selon les Nations unies. Côté français, il s'agit d'une erreur du site de la Commission européenne, modifiée depuis.

title: Un accord russo-iranien à 25 milliards de dollars signé pour construire quatre centrales en Iran
summary: L’Iran et la Russie ont conclu un contrat de 25 milliards de dollars pour la construction de quatre centrales nucléaires dans la province du Hormozgan, au sud de l’Iran, a annoncé la télévision d’État iranienne vendredi. L'accord intervient dans un contexte de tensions internationales autour du programme nucléaire iranien, Téhéran insistant sur son droit au développement du nucléaire à des fins civiles.

title: Un État palestinien serait un "suicide national" pour Israël, affirme Netanyahu à l'ONU
summary: La création d'un État palestinien constituerait un "suicide national" pour Israël, a déclaré vendredi à la tribune de l'ONU le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, promettant de "finir le travail" contre le Hamas à Gaza.

title: L’OTAN renforce sa présence en Baltique après les récents survols de drones au Danemark
summary: Ces nouveaux moyens comprennent du renseignement, de la surveillance, de la reconnaissance et « au moins une frégate de défense aérienne », a déclaré Martin O’Donnell, porte-parole du commandement suprême des alliés en Europe.

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : au moins quatre morts à Kiev et 21 blessés à Zaporijia dans des attaques russes
summary: Le principal conseiller du président Zelensky, Andriy Yermak, a évoqué des assauts avec des drones et des missiles, dans la nuit de samedi à dimanche.

title: Dans l’ouest de l’Allemagne, l’AfD séduit de plus en plus les femmes
summary: Le parti d’extrême droite a doublé son nombre d’élus municipaux à Duisbourg et à Hagen, mi-septembre.

title: Samson de Gaza et Samson d’Ukraine
summary: La catastrophe en cours dans l’enclave palestinienne a conduit à invoquer la figure biblique de Samson, qui s’est suicidé à Gaza pour y tuer le plus grand nombre de Philistins, rappelle l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique hebdomadaire.

title: Le culte numérique de Charlie Kirk, érigé en « treizième apôtre » du Christ grâce à l’IA
summary: De nombreux contenus générés par intelligence artificielle montrant Charlie Kirk au paradis, accompagné par Jésus ou les apôtres, inondent les réseaux sociaux. Ce culte numérique, visant à ériger l’influenceur MAGA en martyr, témoigne de l’emprise croissante d’une grille de lecture millénariste dans le champ politique américain.

title: Montrer une « Amérique telle que Donald Trump la voit, blanche et chrétienne » : à Washington, les musées sous pression de la Maison Blanche
summary: Fondée au XIXᵉ siècle, la Smithsonian Institution regroupe une vingtaine de prestigieux musées, pour la plupart situés dans la capitale fédérale. Ce fleuron de la science et de la culture est, depuis la réélection de Donald Trump, la cible d’une offensive du pouvoir, qui entend imposer son récit national, recentré sur une Amérique blanche et chrétienne et purgé des pages sombres de son histoire.

title: Qu’est-ce que l’autorité palestinienne ? Comprendre en trois minutes
summary: De plus en plus de pays annoncent qu’ils reconnaissent l’Etat de Palestine. Pourtant, les territoires palestiniens disposent déjà d’une entité gouvernementale : l’Autorité palestinienne. Mais ses pouvoirs sont limités et sa légitimité contestée.

title: « Une succursale de l’enfer » : dans la morgue où sont rapatriés les corps de soldats russes tombés en Ukraine
summary: Cauchemar pour les uns, planque pour les autres : dans la morgue de Rostov-sur le-Don, des militaires orchestrent le dernier voyage des morts et tentent de les identifier avec l’aide de leurs proches.

title: Le retour en grâce d’Erik Prince, fondateur de Blackwater
summary: L’ancien PDG de « l’armée privée la plus puissante du monde » reprend son business de la guerre et de la sécurité à travers son entreprise Vectus Global, prônant sans ambages une nouvelle forme de colonialisme dans les Etats rongés par la corruption.

title: Moldavie : outre les soupçons d’ingérences russes, l’extrême droite roumaine s’immisce dans les élections législatives
summary: Avant les élections législatives du 28 septembre, la Moldavie fait face à une vaste campagne d’influence sur les réseaux sociaux, imputée à la Russie. Mais l’extrême droite roumaine est également active pour discréditer le gouvernement pro-européen de la présidente moldave, Maia Sandu.

title: Au Brésil, les mille vies du chef Raoni réunies dans ses Mémoires
summary: Figure incontournable et révérée de la défense des droits des Amérindiens du Brésil, le cacique n’a cessé, tout au long de son combat, de côtoyer chefs d’Etat, têtes couronnées, révolutionnaires et célébrités de tous les pays. A l’occasion de la sortie de ses Mémoires, le nonagénaire sillonne son pays pour raconter avec force anecdotes son incroyable parcours.

title: Nucléaire iranien : le Conseil de sécurité de l’ONU rétablit les sanctions contre Téhéran
summary: Les sanctions sont entrées en vigueur dans la nuit de samedi à dimanche. Le ministère des affaires étrangères iranien a dénoncé le retour « injustifiable » des sanctions « illégales » de l’ONU et appelé les pays à ne pas les appliquer.

title: 10 Palestinians killed as Israel bombs homes in Gaza
summary:
10 Palestinians killed as Israel bombs homes in Gaza

Israeli forces killed at least eight Palestinians in an attack on two homes in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, citing Al-Awda Hospital. 

The Gaza Medical Services Administration said that casualties were also reported in Israeli shelling of homes in the Bureij refugee camp.

Gaza's emergency and ambulance services also reported the killing of two Palestinians in an Israeli drone strike on a house west of the Nuseirat refugee camp.

title: Several injured during pro-Palestine demonstration in Italy
summary:
Several injured during pro-Palestine demonstration in Italy

Some 10 people were injured during clashes that erupted between police and pro-Palestine protestors on Saturday in northern Italy, news agency ANSA reported.

Protesters showing solidarity with Palestine took to the streets and held demonstrations across Turin, in the Piedmont region of Italy.

ANSA reported that police blocked the path of protesters with water cannons and tear gas. The protestors threw rocks, smoke bombs, and firecrackers at the officers.  

Protests, which began on Friday in Rome, Milan, Naples and Bologna, spread on Saturday to Florence, Pisa, Ancona, Trieste, Bari, and Alessandria, Anadolu news agency has reported. 

Demonstrations in support of Palestinians are growing across ports, universities, schools, and public squares, ahead of the national protest scheduled for Oct 4 in Rome.

title: Trump's proposal on Gaza includes destruction of Hamas weapons: Report
summary:
Trump's proposal on Gaza includes destruction of Hamas weapons: Report 

US President Donald Trump's proposal to end the war in Gaza includes the destruction of all offensive weapons belonging to the Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas) and for amnesty for fighters who commit to peaceful coexistence, The Washington Post reported on Saturday. 

According to the 21-point plan, safe passage to other countries would be facilitated for Hamas members who choose to leave, the report mentions. 

The proposal also includes an immediate cessation of all military operations, a freeze of fighting lines in place, and the release of all prisoners within 48 hours.

Hamas on Thursday had said that its "weapons cannot be touched" and that resistance was a national and moral responsibility that derives its legitimacy from the Palestinian people.

The comments come as a response to Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas's speech at the United Nations.

title: 130 public figures urge France and Belgium to protect Global Sumud Flotilla
summary:
130 public figures urge France and Belgium to protect Global Sumud Flotilla

In a joint statement published by the French daily Nouvel Obs on Saturday, 130 public figures urged France and Belgium to ensure diplomatic and consular protection for the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla

"We demand protection for the flotilla and call on the governments of Emmanuel Macron and Bart De Wever to provide diplomatic and consular protection for the boats carrying French and Belgian nationals," the public figures said.

The signatories include Franco-Algerian DJ Snake, Belgian singer Angele, and French content creator Lena Mahfouf.

"We call for immediate action by the French and Belgian states to guarantee humanitarian access to Gaza and to put an end to the genocide of the Palestinian people," the signatories demanded.

A flotilla of 10 vessels set off for Gaza from Sicily, southern Italy, on Saturday, with 60 people on board, including elected officials from nine nations.

A statement from the Freedom Flotilla Coalition (FFC) and the Thousand Madleens to Gaza (TMTG) said they intended to "break the illegal Israeli blockade" to deliver aid to the Palestinian territory.

They intend to join the Global Sumud Flotilla, which is also bound for Gaza carrying aid supplies.

title: Saturday's death toll in Gaza rises to 91
summary:
Saturday's death toll in Gaza rises to 91

Israeli forces have killed at least 91 Palestinians since dawn on Saturday, Al Jazeera Arabic has reported.

At least 48 Palestinians were killed in Gaza City in attacks by Israeli forces, in which six aid seekers were also killed. 

Israeli warplanes also bombed a gathering of civilians in the Saraya area in central Gaza City.

Israeli Defence Minister Yisrael Katz said that the war would not stop until all its goals were achieved, threatening to escalate military operations in Gaza.

title: Israel bombs Khan Younis and Al-Bureij refugee camp in Gaza
summary:
Israel bombs Khan Younis and Al-Bureij refugee camp in Gaza

Israeli forces on Saturday launched air strikes on civilian homes in Khan Yunis, in the southern Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera reported. 

Many casualties were reported from the Nuseirat refugee camp, where Israel bombed a house.

Palestinian media reported that Israeli aircraft targeted the Al-Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza.

title: Israel intensifying attacks in Gaza, defence minister says
summary:
Israel intensifying attacks in Gaza, defence minister says

Israel's Defence Minister Israel Katz on Saturday said that 750,000 Palestinians have evacuated Gaza City as his forces have increased the intensity of their strikes. 

Katz said that Israeli forces are "advancing towards the decisive phase" of the offensive on Gaza.

"Terror towers in the city have been toppled and terror infrastructure has been destroyed," Katz wrote in a post on US social media company X.

Autonomous booby-trapped vehicles are being deployed ahead of Israeli forces to thwart explosives, Katz said, adding that the firepower protecting Israeli forces "is heavy and powerful."

Katz also said that Israeli soldiers are taking "more and more neighbourhoods and territories in Gaza."

צה"ל מגביר את עוצמת התקיפות בעזה ומקדם את שלב ההכרעה.

למעלה מ-750 אלף תושבים התפנו מהעיר עזה דרומה, למרות איומי חמאס, והתנועה נמשכת.

מגדלי טרור בעיר הוקרסו ותשתיות טרור נהרסו. נגמ"שי נפץ אוטונומיים מופעלים לפני הכוחות לסיכול מטענים, ומעטפת האש להגנה על הכוחות המתמרנים מהאוויר…

— ישראל כ”ץ Israel Katz (@Israel_katz) September 27, 2025

title: Reuters investigation debunks Israeli justification for bombing Gaza hospital
summary:
Reuters investigation debunks Israeli justification for bombing Gaza hospital

Israel’s justification for bombing Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis, which killed 21 Palestinians, including five journalists, has been debunked by a Reuters investigation.

Footage of the double-strike attack by Israel on the hospital, the second of which was captured on camera, showed journalists and rescuers on a staircase being directly hit.

Reuters reported that the target of the 25 August strike, which Israel claimed to be a Hamas surveillance device, was a camera belonging to the news agency itself.

The Reuters investigation reviewed visual evidence and interviewed eyewitnesses, establishing that the equipment was being used by its Gaza-based journalist Hussam al-Masri. Al-Masri was also killed in the attack.

title: Iceland: Israel’s actions in Gaza cruel, inhumane and illegal
summary:
Iceland: Israel’s actions in Gaza cruel, inhumane and illegal

Iceland’s foreign minister, Thorgerdur Katrin Gunnarsdottir, on Saturday said that Israel’s actions in Gaza are “cruel, inhumane and illegal”. 

Speaking at the UN General Assembly, she said, “We are witnessing now crimes against humanity and war crimes in broad daylight; what appears before us is systematic ethnic cleansing.” 

“This needs to end. We need an immediate ceasefire, full humanitarian access, and the unconditional release of all hostages.”

Gunnarsdottir added that “nothing” justifies the collective punishment, starvation and forced displacement of Palestinians.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Israel killed another journalist, Mohammed al-Dayah, in Gaza on Saturday, raising the death toll of journalists since the start of the conflict to 252, the Gaza Government Media Office said.

  • The US State Department revoked the visa of left-wing Colombian President Gustavo Petro for remarks made at a pro-Palestine march in New York on Friday. 

  • Hamas has not received US President Donald Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, the Palestinian group said as Israeli forces expanded their assault on Gaza City.

  • Tens of thousands of demonstrators marched through the streets of the German capital to call for an end to Israel's war on Gaza.

  • Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov accused Israel of seeking to "blow up" the whole Middle East as criticised Israel's attacks in Iran and Qatar and opposed calls to annex the occupied West Bank.

  • Israel-Premier Tech have been excluded from the Giro dell’Emilia cycling race on 4 October in Italy for safety reasons, the organisers told the AFP news agency.

  • A flotilla of 10 vessels set off for Gaza from Sicily, southern Italy, with 60 people on board, including elected officials from nine nations, said organisers.

  • San Marino officially declared Palestine a recognised state during a debate at the UN General Assembly.

title: San Marino formally recognises Palestinian state
summary:
San Marino formally recognises Palestinian state

San Marino officially declared Palestine a recognised state during a debate at the United Nations General Assembly on Saturday.

“On May 15, our parliament, with unanimous support, mandated the government to recognise the State of Palestine within this year. Today, before this Assembly, we announce the fulfilment of that mandate: San Marino officially recognises the State of Palestine,” said Foreign Minister Luca Beccari.

Beccari described the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and the West Bank “unbearable” and “one of the most painful and long-standing tragedies of our time", saying that "having a state is the right of the Palestinian people."

title: Saudi FM condemns Israel at UN, calls for two-state solution
summary:
Saudi FM condemns Israel at UN, calls for two-state solution

Saudi Arabia’s foreign minister, Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud, condemned Israel’s conduct of the war in Gaza as a “direct violation” of international law and called for a two-state solution.

“The suffering of the Palestinian people and the unprecedented humanitarian crisis in Gaza that has officially been classified as a famine by the IPC report runs counter to the principles of the Charter and international humanitarian law,” he said in a speech at the United Nations General Assembly.

Al Saud said the “brutal and unchecked practices of the occupying forces, including starvation, forced displacement and systematic killing, show disregard for the rights of Palestinians”

The minister also warned of grave consequences, saying that if the international community fails to act to stop the Israeli aggression, such inaction "will escalate war crimes and acts of genocide."

“Saudi Arabia stresses the need for the international community to shoulder its responsibility to put an end to this tragedy and achieve sustainable peace through the two-state solution as the only path that will guarantee the security of all countries in the region," he said.

summary: Iranian universities and academic centers called on the awakened conscience of the world to join a global campaign titled Protect Scientists.

summary: Iran’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson has firmly rejected the baseless claims made in the joint statement by the [Persian] Gulf Cooperation Council and Britain regarding the three Iranian islands.

summary: Russia’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that the attempt by the European Union’s Troika (Britain, France, and Germany) to reimpose sanctions on Iran is not legally valid.

summary: KHAMENEI.IR, the official social media account of the Leader of the Islamic Revolution, posted on X, describing Israel as the most hated regime in the world.

summary: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi met and held talks with Nicaraguan, Eritrean and Ugandan counterparts in New York.

summary: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said in a letter to the UN Secretary-General and the President of the Security Council that the Islamic Republic of Iran firmly rejects the alleged reinstatement of resolutions terminated under resolution 2231 (2015).

summary: The Public and Revolution Prosecutor of the capital of Kerman province announced the identification and arrest of an individual who was active on social networks in supporting, joining, and recruiting for the terrorist groups Jaysh al-Adl and Ansar al-Furqan.

summary: The foreign ministers of the BRICS organization condemned the military aggression by the United States and the Zionist regime against Iran's nuclear facilities.

summary: Sheikh Naim Qassem vowed that Hezbollah would never lay down its weapons or leave the battlefield.

summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Iranian Army chief says the armed forces continuously monitor the enemy and will respond firmly to any hostile or wrongful action.

summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Foreign Ministry Spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei firmly dismissed the baseless allegations raised in the joint statement of the PGCC-UK foreign ministers’ meeting regarding the three Iranian islands in the Persian Gulf.

title: Iran reacts to activation of snapback mechanism
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – The Iranian Foreign Ministry issued a statement on Sunday in response to the activation of the so-called snapback mechanism and return of the terminated UN sanctions.

title: Gunman kills 3, injures 8 in North Carolina
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – A passing boat opened fire on a crowded dockside restaurant in North Carolina on Saturday night, killing three and injuring at least eight.

title: Iranian foreign minister meets Eritrean counterpart in NY
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi met Osman Saleh Mohammed, Eritrea’s FM, to find pathways for more cooperation between the two Islamic nations.

title: Any illegal anti-Iran move to face serious countermeasures
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Iranian Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf said Tehran will respond with serious reciprocal action if any country takes measures against Iran based on the illegal reimposition of UN sanctions.

title: Russia will give ‘decisive response’ if provoked by West
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Russian Minister of Foreign Affairs Sergey Lavrov has warned NATO and the European Union that “any aggression against my country will be met with a decisive response”.

title: Saudi FM urges diplomatic track for Iran nuclear program
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 28 (MNA) – Saudi Arabia’s Foreign Minister Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud called on the international community to pursue a “diplomatic track” to address Iran’s nuclear program during his speech at the United Nations General Assembly.

title: نماز جمعه قرارگاه فرهنگی مقابله با توطئه‌های دشمن است
summary: نشتارود - رئیس ستاد نماز جمعه استان مازندران با بیان اینکه نماز جمعه یکی از برکات بزرگ انقلاب است، گفت: نماز جمعه قرارگاه فرهنگی مقابله با توطئه‌های دشمن است.

title: ردپای تعارض منافع در مهاجرت پزشکان
summary: عضو کمیسیون بهداشت و درمان مجلس، ردپای تعارض منافع در نظام سلامت را تاثیرگذار در مهاجرت نخبگان پزشکی دانست.

title: توزیع بیش از ۱۳۰۰ تن نهاده دامی و ۳۵۰ تن کود شیمیایی در چهاربرج
summary: ارومیه- مدیر جهاد کشاورزی چهاربرج از توزیع بیش از ۱۳۰۰ تن انواع نهاده‌های دامی و ۳۵۰ تن کود شیمیایی یارانه‌ای در این شهرستان از ابتدای سال جاری تا پایان شهریور ماه خبر داد.

title: واحدهای صنفی متخلف در خرم‌آباد پلمب شدند
summary: خرم‌آباد - رئیس اداره نظارت بر اماکن عمومی انتظامی لرستان از پلمب واحدهای صنفی متخلف در مرکز این استان خبر داد.

title: دادستان تهران از دادسرای عمومی و انقلاب ناحیه یک تهران بازدید کرد
summary: دادستان عمومی و انقلاب تهران در تداوم برنامه‌های نظارت میدانی بر عملکرد دادسراها و به منظور پایش نحوه خدمت رسانی به مردم، به صورت سرزده از دادسرای ناحیه یک تهران بازدید کرد.

title: دوره توانمندسازی بانوان در ایرانشهر برگزار شد
summary: ایرانشهر - به مناسبت هفته دفاع مقدس، دوره‌ی یک‌روزه توانمندسازی مربیان کودک ویژه بانوان، از سوی جامعه زنان ایرانشهر در این شهرستان برگزار شد.
